alert.note: Alert for Chatham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 16 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A nearly stationary heavy shower will impact portions of northeastern Chatham County through 145 AM EDT... At 1242 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a nearly stationary heavy shower near Pittsboro. The shower has already produced over an inch of rain near Pittsboro, and up to another inch is possible. HAZARD...Heavy Rainfall, minor flooding. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall could cause flooded roadways, especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Pittsboro, Jordan Lake, Crosswinds Boating Center, Jordan Lake State Rec Area, Seaforth Boat Dock, Bynum, Crosswinds Campground and Fearrington. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Very heavy rain can be expected due to the slow movement of this storm. Prolonged heavy rain will result in ponding of water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas, and minor flooding of creeks and streams. Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid hydroplaning.
